comment.text: The translation key "RevokeDialogHeader" is used to display the text "Revoke token" in a modal dialog header. It appears when revoking a developer token and serves as a label for the revoke action. Translators should provide an equivalent phrase that communicates this same action in the user's native language.

usage.context:
visible
 onClose={onClose}
 displayType={ModalDialogType.modal}
 autoMaxHeight
 >
 <ModalDialog.Header>{t("OAuth:RevokeDialogHeader")}</ModalDialog.Header>
 <ModalDialog.Body>
 <div>
 <Text style={{ marginBottom: "16px" }} noSelect>
 {t("OAuth:RevokeDialogDescription")}
 </Text>

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The translation 'Չեղյալ համարել նշանը' while conveying a general idea, isn't the most natural or precise translation of "Revoke token". 'Revoke' implies a formal action of invalidating something, and the Armenian translation emphasizes 'considering it invalid'. A better translation would more directly express cancellation or invalidation of the token.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Consider alternatives like 'Ջնջել հաշմանիշը' (Delete the token) or 'Արտեղծել հաշմանիշը' (Invalidate the token).

ai_spell_check_issues.description: While "トークンの取消し" is understandable, it's a somewhat formal and less common phrasing for 'Revoke token' in a UI context. A more natural and user-friendly translation would be something like "トークンを削除" (Token o sakujo) or "トークンを取り消す" (Token o torikesu).
The Lao word 'ແນັ້ນ' is used incorrectly here. It translates to 'that' or 'this' and doesn't fit the context of revoking a token.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Consider using 'ຢ່າງ' or removing it entirely for a more natural phrasing. A possible correction would be 'ຍົກເລີກໂຕ໊ະຄ໌' or 'ຍົກເລີກໂຕ໊ະຄ໌ຢ່າງ'.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The word 'ප්‍රතෝකනය' (prathokanya) might be more accurately translated as 'අවසර පත්‍රය' (awasapthraya) which more closely reflects the concept of a token in this context. 'ප්‍රතෝකනය' can also be used, but 'අවසර පත්‍රය' is more common and understandable for a wider audience.

While 'අහෝසි කරන්න' (ahosi karanna) is a valid translation for 'revoke,' it could be softened to be more user-friendly. 'ඉවත් කරන්න' (iwath karanna) or 'අවලංගු කරන්න' (awalangu karanna) might be more appropriate for a dialog header, especially in a user interface.
The translation 'Опозови токен' incorrectly translates 'Revoke token'. 'Опозови' means 'disgrace' or 'humiliate', not 'revoke'.
The translation 'Belirteci iptal et' is a literal translation and sounds unnatural in Turkish. A more natural and idiomatic translation would be 'Token'i iptal et' or 'Token'i geri çek'.
